question:
A company runs its databases on Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL. The company wants a secure solution to manage the master user password by rotating the password every 30 days.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?

options.A: Use Amazon EventBridge to schedule a custom AWS Lambda function to rotate the password every 30 days.
options.B: Use the modify-db-instance command in the AWS CLI to change the password.
options.C: Integrate AWS Secrets Manager with Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL to automate password rotation.
options.D: Integrate AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store with Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL to automate password rotation.

explanation: AWS Secrets Manager has native integration with RDS for automatic password rotation. It handles the rotation process automatically with built-in Lambda functions, providing the least operational overhead. Parameter Store does not have automatic rotation capabilities.
